title: Definitions
context: [PART VIII.] SECURITY INTERESTS [ยง39-161] Definitions. Whenever used in this part, unless a different meaning clearly appears from the context: &ldquo;Authorizing statute&rdquo; means any statute which authorizes the issuance of bonds. &ldquo;Bonds&rdquo; means any bonds, notes, and other instruments of indebtedness, or lease, lease purchase, or certificates of participation, or other evidence of indebtedness for which a security interest is granted or a pledge made upon revenue or other property to provide for payment or security. &ldquo;Governmental unit&rdquo; means the State of Hawaii, and any state department, board, commission, officer, authority, agency, public corporation, or instrumentality, or the judiciary. &ldquo;Measure&rdquo; means any act, certificate, resolution, statute, or other enactment authorizing the issuance of bonds or authorizing an indenture with respect to bonds pursuant to an authorizing statute. [L 2000, c 28, pt of ยง1]
